published_attributes.title: Learning Plan
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Reasoning

Each person involved in fintech projects needs to have basic understanding of the specificity of the financial institutions and Fintechs sector

E-learning outcomes:

Understanding of:

  • main types of financial entities - role and functions
  • what is Fintech
  • role of Fintech in financial institutions ecosystem

published_attributes.title: Types of Financial Institutions
published_attributes.serialized_body:
• In next slides you will be presented most common financial institutions types with synthetic description.
  • Bare in mind, financial institutions in some cases can be the mixture of presented types
  • The goal of this course is to gain understanding of the differences between given types of institutions
  • Knowing types of financial institutions gives you head start with understanding client business model which is crucial whenever it comes to technological implementations in financial sector

blocks.text: In next slides you will be presented most common financial institutions types with synthetic description.

Knowing types of financial institutions gives you head start with understanding client business model which is crucial whenever it comes to technological implementations in financial sector

published_attributes.title: Retail Banks
published_attributes.serialized_body:
• Retail banking provides financial services to individual consumers rather than large institutions.
  • Services offered include savings and checking accounts, mortgages, personal loans, debit or credit cards, and certificates of deposit (CDs).
  • Retail banks can be local community banks or the divisions of large commercial banks.
  • The very base of Retail Banks business model is to:
    • collect money from deposit client by ensuring them to return them in the future with premiums for customer -/ uszczegółowić i podmienić na pojęcia specjalistyczne
    • give away money to credit clients that most likely will give it back with premium for bank (estimation of that likelihood is called credit scoring)

blocks.text: Retail banking provides financial services to individual consumers rather than large institutions.
Services offered include savings and checking accounts, mortgages, personal loans, debit or credit cards, and certificates of deposit (CDs).
Retail banks can be local community banks or the divisions of large commercial banks.
The very base of Retail Banks business model is to:

collect money from deposit client by ensuring them to return them in the future with premiums for customer
-/ uszczegółowić i podmienić na pojęcia specjalistyczne
give away money to credit clients that most likely will give it back with premium for bank (estimation of that likelihood is called credit scoring)

published_attributes.title: Lending Company
published_attributes.serialized_body:
• a public or private group, or a financial institution that makes funds available to a person or business with the expectation that the funds will be repaid.
  • Repayment will include the payment of any interest or fees.
  • Repayment may occur in increments (as in a monthly mortgage payment) or as a lump sum.
  • Key difference between Retails Banks and Lending Companies are:
    • the special rights of Banks that allows them to collect money from private individuals as deposits and instant give away of that money to another customer seeking credit
    • Lending Companies gather funds usually by issuing bonds or other financial instruments which are not intended to be offered to private individuals

Lending Companies gather funds usually by issuing bonds or other financial instruments which are not intended to be offered to private individuals

published_attributes.title: Investment Banks
published_attributes.serialized_body:
• Investment banks specialize in managing complex financial transactions such as IPOs (issuing shares of company) and mergers for corporate clients.
  • Modern investment banking is typically a division of a bigger bank institution such as Citibank and JPMorgan Chase.
  • Ever since spectacular mismanagement scandals there has been a requirement to separate investment banking activities from the company's trading division to prevent conflicts of interest.
  • Investment Banks are banks only in name, they do not have rights related to deposits as retails banks. The name is a relicts of times when mixing the deposits gathering and issuing extremely risky securities were OK for Financial Supervision Authority
  • Investment Banks focus on large deals and long term relationship with customers.

blocks.text: Investment banks specialize in managing complex financial transactions such as IPOs (issuing shares of company) and mergers for corporate clients.
Modern investment banking is typically a division of a bigger bank institution such as Citibank and JPMorgan Chase.
Ever since spectacular mismanagement scandals there has been a requirement to separate investment banking activities from the company's trading division to prevent conflicts of interest.

Investment Banks are banks only in name, they do not have rights related to deposits as retails banks. The name is a relicts of times when mixing the deposits gathering and issuing extremely risky securities were OK for Financial Supervision Authority
Investment Banks focus on large deals and long term relationship with customers.

published_attributes.title: Brokerage Firms
published_attributes.serialized_body:
• A brokerage company primarily acts as a middleman to connect buyers and sellers to facilitate a transaction.
  • Typically receive one of two types of commission: a flat fee or a percentage of the transaction amount.
  • Brokerage companies come in several types, offering a range of products and services at a range of costs and fees.
  • Brokerage Firms focus on smaller deals and usually do not invest in long term relationship with customers

blocks.text: A brokerage company primarily acts as a middleman to connect buyers and sellers to facilitate a transaction.

Brokerage companies come in several types, offering a range of products and services at a range of costs and fees.
Brokerage Firms focus on smaller deals and usually do not invest in long term relationship with customers

targets mostly smaller, quick to execute deals and do not invest significant resources in long run relationship with customers

published_attributes.title: Private Banking
published_attributes.serialized_body:
• Private banking is an enhanced offering for the high-net-worth individual (HNWI) clients of a financial institution.
  • Private banking consists of personalised financial and investment services and products from a dedicated personal banker.
  • Private banking clients typically receive discounts or preferential pricing on financial products.
  • However, the range of products and investment expertise offered by a private bank may be limited compared to other providers.
  • Private Banking focus on personalized approach and care.

blocks.text: Private banking is an enhanced offering for the high-net-worth individual (HNWI) clients of a financial institution.

Private banking clients typically receive discounts or preferential pricing on financial products.
However, the range of products and investment expertise offered by a private bank may be limited compared to other providers.
Private Banking focus on  personalized approach and care.

published_attributes.title: Wealth Management
published_attributes.serialized_body:
• Wealth management is an investment advisory service that combines other financial services to address the needs of affluent clients. A wealth management advisor is a high-level professional who manages an affluent client’s wealth holistically, typically for one set fee.
  • This service is usually appropriate for wealthy individuals with a broad array of diverse needs.
  • Wealth Management focus on financial product offered to client (matching investment approach or need) rather than personalized care

blocks.text: Wealth management is an investment advisory service that combines other financial services to address the needs of affluent clients. A wealth management advisor is a high-level professional who manages an affluent client’s wealth holistically, typically for one set fee.
This service is usually appropriate for wealthy individuals with a broad array of diverse needs.
Wealth Management focus on financial product offered to client (matching investment approach or need) rather than personalized care

answers.definition: a service focused on optimization of a client's portfolio, taking into account their aversion to, or comfort with, risk, and investing financial assets according to their plans and goals. Key difference compare to Private Banking is focus on financial product offered to client (matching investment approach or need) rather than personalized care

published_attributes.title: Collective Investment Fund
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Most Common type of Investments funds (Europe and Asia) are Undertakings Collective Investment in Transferable Securities (usually referred as UCITS)

  • Investment framework where fund managers take care of single investment strategy for whole fund (no special strategies for each investor)
  • Provide professional investment plan for investors with minimal financial input (private individuals can buy shares/ units for as little as few EUR)
  • Most private pension plans operate as CIF (Collective Investment Fund)
  • Funds can grow to gargantuan proportions (current valuation of UCITS EuroZone is 12.2 trillion EUR one of the biggest UCITS the iShares Core S&P 500 UCITS ETF has total valuation of 51,8 billion USD)

published_attributes.title: Fintech Definition
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Fintech has two meanings

  1. Any tech improvement related to financial sector
  2. Company that use innovative technological approach and/ or business model to provide financial service
  • Fintech companies are Financial Institutions as well. The term fintech simply point technological advantage of company

  • Very often this approach allows to operate without licence that is required in old fashion approach or operate under special fin-tech licence

blocks.text: Fintech has two meanings

Company that use innovative technological approach and/ or business model to provide financial service
Fintech companies are Financial Institutions as well. The term fintech simply point technological advantage of company
Very often this approach allows to operate without licence that is required in old fashion approach or operate under special fin-tech licence

published_attributes.title: Fintech Characteristics
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Key Specifics:

  • Fintech refers to the integration of technology into offerings by financial services companies in order to improve their use and delivery to consumers.
  • It primarily works by unbundling offerings by such firms and creating new markets for them. Startups disrupt incumbents in the finance industry by expanding financial inclusion and using technology to cut down on operational costs.
  • Fintech funding is on the rise but regulatory problems abound.
  • Fintech are part of financial ecosystem therefore it cooperate with traditional financial institutions.

Fintech and type of institutions

  • Each of presented type of financial institutions have example of Fintech company that implement disruptive technology. The technologies that have started to change its part of market
  • Knowing types of financial institutions gives you head start with understanding client business model which is crucial whenever it comes to technological implementations in financial sector

blocks.text: Key Specifics:
Fintech refers to the integration of technology into offerings by financial services companies in order to improve their use and delivery to consumers.

It primarily works by unbundling offerings by such firms and creating new markets for them. Startups disrupt incumbents in the finance industry by expanding financial inclusion and using technology to cut down on operational costs.
Fintech funding is on the rise but regulatory problems abound.
Fintech are part of financial ecosystem therefore it cooperate with traditional financial institutions.
Fintech and type of institutions
Each of presented type of financial institutions have example of Fintech company that implement disruptive technology. The technologies that have started to change its part of market
Knowing types of financial institutions gives you head start with understanding client business model which is crucial whenever it comes to technological implementations in financial sector
